question: Can AutoML techniques currently surpass the performance of human-designed models on high-leverage climate change machine learning (CCML) applications such as climate modeling, wind power forecasting, and catalyst discovery?
answer: No, out-of-the-box AutoML libraries currently fail to meaningfully surpass the performance of human-designed CCML models, but addressing the weaknesses of AutoML techniques can lead to the discovery of novel architectures that yield substantial performance gains across numerous CCML applications.
